item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Right click > save page as.
notepad.exe > open index.html > Delete delete delete delete etc etc

This seriously one of the most pointless things known to man and it has nothing to do with Private server client hacking. At all!

item.title: Runescape webpage (halloween) 1st one i made! (small tutorial too)
item.dc:creator: @qoodscape qoodscape
item.description:
@qoodscape wrote:

First of all id like to point out this is NOT a release unless poeple want me to release.
please do not flame if i have this topic in wrong spot i thought this was considered private server hacking
also please do not flame the pictures as they were done in paint. (the typing was really bad so can some1 tell me how to make smaller in paint? or a better program to use?(the html itself was done in notepad)
First Html page i ever did!

Pictures (halloween) if poeple like i will update and release every holiday!

28meng5.jpg1154×699

Btw here are the html code thing if you want to make one similar:

Open up “notepad” put this in it

[code]

Server Name
Server Name
[/code]

Save it as

index.html

Now Open another Notepad put this in it.

body { text-align: center; background-image: url(sidebar.bmp); } #wrapper { margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 850px; text-align: left; } #banner { width: 770px; height: 130px; text-align: center; float: left; background-image: url(logo.jpg); } #navigation { width: 770px; height: 25px; text-align: left; float: left; background-image: url(log.bmp); border-style: solid; border-width: 1px; border-color: #2f2f2f; } #news { margin-top: 3px; width: 265px; height: 780px; background-image: url(articles.bmp); float: left; margin-right: 3px; } #content { margin-top: 3px; width: 548px; height: 672px; background-image: url(updates.bmp); float: left; }
Save this notepad as

style.css

Please note the image urls you DO NOT HAVE on your computer! this is how you do it though make a picture save it as
untitled (thats an example can be anything) and say its a .jpg file then the code would look like this

background-image: url(untitled.jpg);

anyways hope you enjoy if you make one and are wondering how to put it onto your website PM me ill tell you how!
Please comment
PS once again if someone knows how to fix that horrible text! (making smaller) PLEASE REPLY HOW!
Thanks!
-made by qoodscape-

Read full topic
